description: The left budding sequence: # of i such that 0<i<=n and 0 < {tau*i} <= {tau*n}, where {} is fractional part.
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
N. J. A. Sloane, Classic Sequences
mathematica: r = GoldenRatio; p[x_] := FractionalPart[x];u[n_, k_] := If[p[k*r] <= p[n*r], 1, 0]v[n_, k_] := If[p[k*r] > p[n*r], 1, 0]s[n_] := Sum[u[n, k], {k, 1, n}]t[n_] := Sum[v[n, k], {k, 1, n}]Table[s[n], {n, 1, 100}]  (* A019587 *)Table[t[n], {n, 1, 100}]  (* A194733 *)(* _Clark Kimberling_, Sep 02 2011 *)
prog: (Haskell)a019587 n = length $ filter (<= nTau) $            map (snd . properFraction . (* tau) . fromInteger) [1..n]   where (_, nTau) = properFraction (tau * fromInteger n)         tau = (1 + sqrt 5) / 2-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jan 28 2012
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_ and _J. H. Conway_
